title.narrative: OUTPUT 7.4: COMMUNICATION - ADVOCACY & PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas (Covid), Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, the country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet standards in achieving results for children

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: Emergencies and epidemics, including the latest Ebola outbreak;in the eastern DRC, COVID-19 pandemic and the meningitis epidemics in Banalia(Tshopo Province) increased media requests/coverage on the country. Forty-three; statements and press releases contributed to a large-scale media coverage on UNICEF’s response in the country. UNICEF DRC posted 2,240 publications on its external digital platforms. These publications reached 243,622,707 people and generated 7,165,424 acts of engagement (shares, comments, likes, etc.). At the end of November 2021, a total of 1,156,974 people were;following UNICEF DRC on a daily basis on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and LinkedIn. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/12/2021
